meanings.definition: To emit a stream of liquid forcefully
meanings.sent1: The whale spouted water from its blowhole.
meanings.sent2: The fountain spouted water into the air.
meanings.sent3: The teapot spouted hot tea all over the table.
meanings.sent4: The broken pipe spouted water like a mini waterfall.
meanings.sent5: The geyser spouted steam and hot water high into the sky.

meanings.definition: To speak in a pompous or self-important manner
meanings.sent1: The politician spouted promises during the speech.
meanings.sent2: The professor spouted facts to impress the students.
meanings.sent3: The parrot spouted nonsense in a mock serious tone.
meanings.sent4: The CEO spouted orders as if they were royal decrees.
meanings.sent5: The know-it-all spouted opinions without listening to others.
